multiplechoiceresponse.label: How can you moderate the responses on this table?

choicegroup.choice: Change the original form. Don't change the form once it's live! You'll only mess up your data.
Edit the spreadsheet in Google Sheets.
Get the CSV from Files & Uploads and edit it. You don't need to download the spreadsheet in this setup - you point to its published URL instead.
Ask your learners to edit their response. We don't recommend letting learners edit their responses. It's more trouble than it's worth.
Create a second sheet with the responses you want published.

div.p: You can edit the spreadsheet to change what appears on the table. We recommend only deleting whole lines, or maybe removing some swear-words if you want. Alternatively, if you want active moderation instead of reactive (that is, you want to have to approve each entry), you should build a second sheet where you put the responses that you like, and publish that sheet instead.
